meanings.definition: The quality of sticking or clinging to a surface or object.
meanings.sent1: The adhesiveness of the tape kept the paper in place.
meanings.sent2: The glue's adhesiveness made sure the pieces stayed together.
meanings.sent3: The adhesiveness of the sticker was so strong, it stuck to my finger by accident.
meanings.sent4: The adhesiveness of the relationship between the two friends was like glue, never letting them drift apart.
meanings.sent5: The adhesiveness of the spider's web was remarkable, catching even the tiniest insects.

meanings.definition: The ability to form a strong bond or connection with something.
meanings.sent1: Her adhesiveness to her beliefs never wavered.
meanings.sent2: The adhesiveness between the siblings was evident in their unwavering support for each other.
meanings.sent3: The adhesiveness of the magnet to the fridge was so strong, it was hard to remove.
meanings.sent4: The adhesiveness of the team's spirit was like a glue that held them together through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The adhesiveness of the new friendship formed quickly, creating a strong bond between the two.

meanings.definition: The tendency to remain united or attached.
meanings.sent1: The adhesiveness of the group was evident in their solidarity during the crisis.
meanings.sent2: The adhesiveness of the paint to the wall ensured a long-lasting finish.
meanings.sent3: The adhesiveness of the label to the jar made it difficult to peel off.
meanings.sent4: The adhesiveness of the community was like a warm embrace, keeping everyone connected.
meanings.sent5: The adhesiveness of the team's spirit was unbreakable, leading them to victory.
